[strike]I really do love this first-person shooter. The adrenaline and dopamine released inside your big brain after completing a 400 IQ play is what continuously brings me back to my computer. I have around 360 hours in the game, a testament to its hook factor.

Besides my personal feelings towards CS:GO, It offers various different game modes, from the blood bath that is a deathmatch to Competitive where skill, luck, tactics and communication is crucial to be victorious. One can pick up the game for free, although it is advised that you purchase prime to avoid encountering hackers on a more regular basis. (Prime can also be achieved by reaching rank 21 in the game.) Skins are also available to purchase, to truly customise your loadout, but they aren't required to perform better as they do not have an advantage over the stock skins.

All in all, CS:GO is a masterpiece until you get mauled by a Noob Cannon from the other side of the map, then, CS:GO is vexatious.[/strike]
